location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No.61 of 1875 from Colonel Sir Lewis Pelly, Agent Governor General and Special Commissioner administering the Baroda state to Mr Jugjeevundass Kooshaldass, Chief Magistrate, Baroda

mods.abstract: Letter regarding accusations of bribery and fraud which have been made against Wassantram Bhao, formerly Head Treasurer to His Highness the Gaekwar of Baroda and requesting he be arrested, formerly charged and brought to trial. The letter also states that there are other cases against him being investigated and that if appropriate they will also be turned over to him in the near future.The letter concludes by requesting that Ranees Jamdar Khana be kept under surveillance until he had accounted for forty lacs [lakhs] he had removed from the palace and attempted to take to Bombay.
